title: Unit 8: Applications of Integration
subtitle: Use integrals to find volumes, work, and more
description: Apply integration techniques to solve real-world problems involving volumes, work, and other applications.
objectives: Calculate volumes of revolution using integrals
Use integrals to calculate work and energy
bigIdeas: Volumes: Integrals calculate volumes of three-dimensional objects
Work: Integration measures work done by forces over distances
Accumulation: Integrals represent accumulated quantities over time
Physics: Integration connects to physical concepts like work and energy
Applications: Integration solves complex real-world problems

lessons.title: Finding the Average Value of a Function on an Interval
lessons.description: Learn to calculate the average value of a function using definite integrals.

lessons.title: Connecting Position, Velocity, and Acceleration Using Integrals
lessons.description: Use integrals to move between velocity and position or between acceleration and velocity.

lessons.title: Using Accumulation Functions and Definite Integrals in Applied Contexts
lessons.description: Apply integration in real-world accumulation problems using graphical and analytical methods.

lessons.title: Finding the Area Between Curves (Functions of x)
lessons.description: Use definite integrals to find areas between two curves in terms of x.

lessons.title: Finding the Area Between Curves (Functions of y)
lessons.description: Calculate areas between curves when expressed as functions of y.

lessons.title: Finding the Area Between Curves That Intersect at More Than Two Points
lessons.description: Identify correct intervals and switching curves when intersections change order.

lessons.title: Volumes with Cross Sections: Squares and Rectangles
lessons.description: Use integration to find volumes of solids built from square or rectangular cross-sections.

lessons.title: Volumes with Cross Sections: Triangles and Semicircles
lessons.description: Apply known area formulas to find volumes of solids with triangular or semicircular cross-sections.

lessons.title: Volume with Disc Method: Revolving Around x- or y-Axis
lessons.description: Use the disc method to find volumes of solids of revolution about major axes.

lessons.title: Volume with Disc Method: Revolving Around Other Axes
lessons.description: Extend the disc method to solids rotated around horizontal or vertical lines other than axes.

lessons.title: Volume with Washer Method: Revolving Around x- or y-Axis
lessons.description: Find volumes of solids of revolution with holes using the washer method.

lessons.title: Volume with Washer Method: Revolving Around Other Axes
lessons.description: Apply the washer method to rotations about lines other than the x- or y-axis.
